org.sdsu.intelligrid.graphics.ui

Interface Clickable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Drawable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClickableSprite

    public interface Clickable
extends Drawable
    Interface for encapsulating clickable objects.

    The dimensions are in openGL coordinates, so bounds of [-0.1,-0.1] to [0.1,0.1] defines a clickable 160-pixel square (on our device) centered on the object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2f getBoundLL()
      Gets the clickable object's lower left corner of its clickable bounds.
      Vector2f getBoundUR()
      Gets the clickable object's upper right corner of its clickable bounds.
      int getDepth()
      Gets the clickable object's interface depth.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Gets the clickable object's identifier.
      Vector2f getLocation()
      Gets the clickable object's location, in openGL coordinates ( [0,0] is the center of the screen).

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sdsu.intelligrid.graphics.Drawable

        advance, draw

    • Method Detail

      • getBoundLL

        Vector2f getBoundLL()
        Gets the clickable object's lower left corner of its clickable bounds.
        Returns:
        the clickable object's lower left bounds

      • getBoundUR

        Vector2f getBoundUR()
        Gets the clickable object's upper right corner of its clickable bounds.
        Returns:
        the clickable object's upper right bounds

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Gets the clickable object's identifier. This is designed for internal use in InputHook, so you don't have to extend different classes for every single button.
        Returns:
        the clickable object's identifier

      • getDepth

        int getDepth()
        Gets the clickable object's interface depth. A lower depth means the object's click priority is higher (reflecting a more frontward location on the screen).
        Returns:
        the clickable object's interface depth

      • getLocation

        Vector2f getLocation()
        Gets the clickable object's location, in openGL coordinates ( [0,0] is the center of the screen). The clickable bounds are centered on this location.
        Specified by:
        getLocation in interface Drawable
        Returns:
        the clickable object's location
